<<<api>>>: DataOutputStream.write
<<<code>>>: public void run() {
    while (true) {
        try {
            socket = new Socket(actuatorAddress, destPort.get());
            outToServer = socket.getOutputStream();
            out = new DataOutputStream(outToServer);
            out.flush();
            out.write(message.getBytes());
        } catch (IOException ex) {
            System.out.println(ex.getMessage());
            try {
                Thread.sleep(5000); // Wait for 5 seconds before trying to reconnect
            } catch (InterruptedException e) {
                e.printStackTrace();
            }
            continue;
        }
        break;
    }
}
<<<explanation>>>: In the given code, we are trying to establish a connection to the server in a while loop. If the connection is successful, we send the message and break the loop. If the connection fails, we catch the IOException, print the error message, and then wait for 5 seconds before trying to reconnect. This way, the thread will keep trying to connect to the server indefinitely until it is successful.
